reviewText: The most acceptable/tolerable of the CGA games (that means FOUR COLORS for anyone not old enough to know) in the Apogee pack... however this was an era of platforming well forgotten for a reason.  Movement is choppy and jumping is outright bizarre... The game manages to be entertaining as a representative of its rough era though. Can't say the same about Arctic Adventure or Pharoah's Tomb.

reviewText: Pleasant surprise finding this inside the 3D realms bundle. One of the first games I recall playing as a kid, spent hours and hours of problem solving and frustration. Must have been 4 or 5 years old when I played this, I forgot it even existed. Weird pre-nostalgia feeling as I play it, totally awesome and unexpected. Thanks for making it available!

reviewText: Based on the FAST engine, Monuments of Mars takes most of the best elements of Pharaoh's Tomb and adds new challenges. Astronauts have been disappearing in ruins on Mars, and your job is to discover the secrets and rescue the survivors. Gameplay is quite different from the Nevada Smith series because many areas only become accessible after tripping invisible switches, and there are movable blocks. Having a changeable environment is a great twist. Your character has infinite lives, but it's still a good idea to save in case you get stuck somewhere and can't die. Poor collision detection makes some of the later levels more frustrating than necessary. Developed by Scenario Software, Todd Replogle misspelled the name of his own company, listing it as Scenerio Software" on the title page! There are 20 levels in each volume
date: which must be played sequentially because there is no map screen. There are 4 volumes in this game
recommended: with only the first volume playable in the shareware version."

reviewText:
In Monuments of Mars" you explore the red planet in order to find out what happened to former astronauts not coming back from their mission.
This game from 1991 is an Apogee title I did NOT play during my childhood (I played a lot of Apogee games) so 31 year old-me experienced this crude-looking mars mission first-time.

Every screen you enter and leave is its own level. So you have to make your way to the exit but every level gets a bit more challenging. Either its aliens
helpfulPercent: you should survive it all. And also think your way out in order to open closed gates or use moving platforms wisely. And that's pretty much it.\nAnd the control is very basic and easy
votesTotal: it looks very dated and barely even has sound but if you like playing games like this one for nostalgia and don't feel bothered by all this you can get some nostalgic
votesFunny: cool sci-fi entertainment out of this."
